content:
/>
XIV.4.A.1.b
.
Definition:  FTI
Federal tax information
(FTI) is any return or return information received from the IRS or secondary source, such as SSA.  It includes any information created by the recipient (in this case, VA) from the return or return information (for example: due process letters or upfront verification development letters).
FTI is not
information provided directly by the taxpayer or third party (to include payer), including an
IRS Form W-2, Wage and Tax Statement
, or
1040, U.S. Individual Income Tax Return
, or
VA letters received by the claimant or beneficiary and subsequently returned to VA.
Important
:
Undeliverable returned mail regarding FTI requires safeguarding regardless of the original intended recipient.
Reference
:  For IRS definitions of return and return information, see
IRS Publication 1075
.
title: M21-1, Part XIV, Chapter 4, Section A - Federal Tax Information (FTI) Match:  General Information
